bwwExcerpt: Notwithstanding the dynamic score, "Six" is weighed down by a labored book (which is built around a flimsy setup and banal banter), bargain-basement scenic design, and clunky dance choreography. That being said, "Six," which was highly anticipated before the shutdown, still has the makings of a solid hit. The history-meets-contemporary pop concept certainly worked out well for a little show called "Hamilton," and it is easy to imagine "Six" appealing to teen girls, history buffs, and many others
